about.title: About Us
about.storyP1: C.L. Bailey & Co. was founded in 1999 by Charles L. Bailey with a single conviction: that game room furniture should be built the way homes used to be — with solid wood, honest joinery, and no shortcuts.
about.storyP2: What began as a small workshop in Tomball, Texas, has grown into one of the most respected names in billiards manufacturing. Every piece that leaves our facility carries the same promise it did on day one: real hardwood, real craftsmanship, and a lifetime structural guarantee.
about.storyP3: We don't chase trends. We don't cut corners with particle board or veneer. We build furniture that belongs in homes where quality still matters — and we stand behind every piece for as long as you own it.
about.principle1Desc: Every piece is built from genuine hardwood. No particle board. No MDF. No veneer over engineered substrates.
about.principle2Desc: We stand behind the structural integrity of every product for as long as you own it.
about.principle3Desc: Every table is delivered and professionally installed by an authorized dealer in your area.
about.heritageSubtext: Every table that leaves our Tomball facility carries the same promise it did on day one: solid hardwood, lifetime guarantee, no compromises.

careGuide.title: Table Care Guide
careGuide.label: Maintenance
careGuide.intro: Proper care keeps your table playing true and looking sharp for decades. These guidelines apply to all C.L. Bailey products.
careGuide.section1Body: Brush the cloth after every session using a soft-bristle pool table brush, always moving in one direction. Vacuum gently on a low setting once a month. Never use water, solvents, or household cleaners on the felt. If a spill occurs, blot immediately with a dry cloth. Consider re-felting every 3–5 years depending on usage.
careGuide.section2Body: Wipe the rails, legs, and frame with a soft, dry microfiber cloth weekly. For deeper cleaning, use a wood-safe furniture polish sparingly. Avoid placing drinks directly on the rails — use coasters. Keep the table out of direct sunlight to prevent fading and warping. Maintain consistent room humidity (40–60%) to prevent wood expansion or contraction.
careGuide.section3Body: Check your table's level every 6 months using a machinist's level. Minor adjustments can be made at the leg levelers. If the slate shifts significantly, contact your authorized dealer for professional re-leveling. Never attempt to move a fully assembled table — always have it professionally disassembled and reassembled.
careGuide.section4Body: Inspect pocket liners and bolts quarterly. Tighten any loose hardware gently. If pocket nets show wear or fraying, replacements are available through your dealer. Keep ball return tracks clean and free of debris.
careGuide.section5Body: Apply shuffleboard wax (silicone spray or powder) before each playing session. Clean the playfield with a soft cloth and shuffleboard cleaner monthly. Never use water or abrasive cleaners on the playfield. Check the climatic adjusters seasonally to ensure the board maintains proper concavity. Store pucks flat and clean to prevent surface scoring.

guarantee.title: Lifetime Guarantee
guarantee.promiseP1: Every C.L. Bailey product is backed by a lifetime structural guarantee. We guarantee the structural integrity of the frame, legs, and body of your table for as long as you own it.
guarantee.promiseP2: This is not a limited warranty. This is our commitment to the quality of our craftsmanship and materials. If a structural defect appears under normal residential use, we will repair or replace the affected component at no cost to you.
guarantee.covered1Desc: All load-bearing frame members, cross supports, and body panels.
guarantee.covered2Desc: Leg joints, leg posts, and integrated leveling mechanisms.
guarantee.covered3Desc: The slate support system and mounting hardware.
guarantee.covered4Desc: Rail mounting points and structural rail components.
guarantee.claimP1: To make a warranty claim, contact your authorized dealer or reach out to us directly. We'll work with you and your dealer to assess the issue and arrange for repair or replacement.
guarantee.claimP2: Please have your original purchase information available, including the dealer name, approximate date of purchase, and product model. Photos of the issue are helpful and can speed up the process.
guarantee.claimP3: This guarantee covers structural defects under normal residential use. It does not cover cosmetic wear, cloth, felt, bumpers, pockets, or damage from misuse, commercial use, or improper moving.

roomSize.title: Room Size Chart
roomSize.label: Size Guide
roomSize.description: The right table starts with the right room. These minimums assume a standard 52″ cue with full stroke clearance on all sides.
roomSize.note1: These measurements assume a standard 52″ (132 cm) cue. If you use shorter cues (48″ or 36″), the minimum room size can be reduced proportionally.
roomSize.note2: Recommended sizes add 6–12 inches on each side for comfortable cueing without wall interference. For rooms that double as living spaces, aim for the recommended dimensions.
